channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2128] Eva Mendes Sex Tape Released (NSFW)
item.description: The sex tape everyone has been waiting for is finally here. You won't believe what kinds of positions Eva gets into.

item.title: [+2044] Lies (pic)
[+1931] America in Color from 1939-1943 [PICS]
item.description: These images, by photographers of the Farm Security Administration/Office of War Information, are some of the only color photographs taken of the effects of the Depression on America’s rural and small town populations. The photographs are the property of the Library of Congress and were included in a 2006 exhibit Bound for Glory: America in Color.

item.title: [+1240] Friends Torture Roommate For Bedding Their Ex
item.description: The two roommates beat, taunted and poured boiling water over her for 18 hours, forcing her to yell "I'm a whore with AIDS."

item.title: [+1188] Parakeet Tricks Kitten With Friendship [pics]
item.description: A kitten thinks he has a new best friendship until he learns the awful truth of their relationship...

item.title: [+1121] The Campaign Against a Mosque at Ground Zero is Un-American
item.description: Republicans and leaders of other faiths are rallying against the building by a Muslim organization of a "community center"—including a mosque—two blocks from Ground Zero, calling it a threat to American values. But the threat to our values isn't coming from the mosque. It's coming from those who want to stop it.

item.title: [+1113] No Seriously WTF News (pic)
[+1089] Prof. Hacker says 'Higher Education' Is A Waste Of Money
item.description: Professor Andrew Hacker says that higher education in the U.S. is broken. He argues that too many undergraduate courses are taught by graduate assistants or professors who have no interest in teaching. Hacker proposes numerous changes, including an end to the tenure system.

item.title: [+891] Thirty Books Everyone Should Read Before They’re Thirty
item.description: The thirty books listed here are of unparalleled prose, packed with wisdom capable of igniting a new understanding of the world. Everyone should read these books before their thirtieth birthday.

item.title: [+671] How The “Inception” Score’s Main Song Was Constructed
item.description: The Edith Piaf song, "Non, je ne Regrette Rien" is used by characters in "Inception" like an alarm to wake from dreaming. It's a lovely touch, and one exploited by composer Hans Zimmer in assembling the film's entire score.

item.title: [+655] This is Why Your Music Store Clerk Hates You [VIDs]
item.description: Two clerks at a music store somewhere in Alabama dilmed a succint explanation as to why the business of selling instruments can be a real pain in the ass.

item.title: [+654] Glass invented in 1962 could be multibillion-dollar bonanza
item.description: An ultra-strong glass that has been looking for a purpose since its invention in 1962 is poised to become a multibillion-dollar bonanza for Corning Inc. The 159-year-old glass pioneer is ramping up production of what it calls Gorilla glass, expecting it to be the hot new face of touch-screen tablets and high-end TVs.

item.title: [+641] Tin Man, How Can I Ever Thank You (GIF)
item.description: Don't get oil all over your ruby slippers, Dorothy.

item.title: [+639] Congressman Calls For Execution Of Wikileaks Whistleblower
item.description: Because really, what's one more killing, right?

item.title: [+627] Greenspan: End Bush tax cuts
item.description: Former Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan believes that the US should "follow the law" and let the Bush tax cuts lapse. He disagreed Sunday with Republicans who say that tax cuts pay for themselves.

item.title: [+562] 7 Podcasts Every Guy Should Listen To
item.description: The number and variety of podcasts available on the internet is growing rapidly. It can be a lot to wade through on your own. That’s why we’ve compiled a shortlist of ones that every guy needs to start listening to now.

item.title: [+540] Artist uses her 38DD breasts as her paint brushes
item.description: A BUSTY artist is putting her 38DD boobs to good use — by PAINTING pictures with them.Kira Ayn Varszegi covers her breasts in paint and then presses them like brushes against her canvases.

item.title: [+536] Hacker Wonderland: DefCon 18 [PICS]
item.description: Roughly 10,000 computer hacking enthusiasts, poseurs, geeks, nerds and government agents gathered for DefCon this weekend. In its 18th year, the world’s largest hacker convention draws people from all walks of life to learn about the latest hacking techniques. Here is a look at some of the highlights of DefCon 18.

item.title: [+513] The Best Cubicle Ever (PIC)
[+511] How U.S. Military Learns to Fight Deadliest Weapons
item.description: The most deadly weapons in Iraq and Afghanistan aren’t AK-47s or grenades — they’re roadside bombs made out of gas cans, garage door openers, and fertilizer. Here’s how the U.S. military is fighting back.
